system.description: As precise and accurate as a well-crafted arrow, archers don't mess around. They prefer to keep their distance, as that is where they are the most effective, never letting anyone get too close to them. Archers are direct and focused and thus make the best guards. Ever vigilant, archers are always looking ahead as, if taken by surprise, they are easily killed. If you are playing an Archer be direct, and on target, sturdy and perhaps high strung, watchful of the future and of your back.

results.hit: Target takes a vitals hack of your choice.
results.critHit: If you want, target takes standard damage as well.

overview.base: You turn an arrow into a conjured ray spell of your choice and may cast it as your next attack. If you choose to make it UB using Energy Blast Arrow, you may turn it into a conjured ball spell instead. You are not proficient with this attack and cannot heighten it.
overview.proficient: You are now proficient with the spells you arrows turn into. You still cannot heighten them.
overview.fluent: You are now fluent with the spells you arrows turn into.

results.save: The attack's effect fizzles and the attacker is snared.

system.endCondition: At the end of each of the target's turns, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.
system.requirements: You block with a bow or your hand.

overview.base: The extra attacks you make with Multi-Shot all count as a single attack for the purpose of attack penalties.
You are an expert hunter. In addition, you have adept Slay for one species of your choice. You can change the species once per a short rest.

Target takes an additional [[/roll 5]] damage. This has all damage types of the triggering attack. If this damage would reduce the target to 0 or fewer HP, they are killed instead. If the triggering attack was a critical hit, this deals [[/roll 10]] damage instead.

system.trigger: You have just hit a creature with an attack that dealt them damage from it.
system.limitation: Only usable against one species, as specified when you use Gamesman.

overview.base: Any warded attacks you make with bows or arrows are boosted.
